meanings.definition: A person engaged in physical work, especially in manual labor.
meanings.sent1: The labourer carried heavy boxes at the warehouse.
meanings.sent2: The construction site employed many labourers to help build the new houses.
meanings.sent3: The tired labourer joked that their muscles were going on strike.
meanings.sent4: She was a true labourer, planting seeds of hard work that would one day bloom into success.
meanings.sent5: The image of the labourer sweating under the sun stuck in his mind as a symbol of dedication.

meanings.sent1: She had to labour for hours to finish her project on time.
meanings.sent2: The ants labour tirelessly to gather food for the winter.
meanings.sent3: He decided to labour through the night to complete the task before the deadline.
meanings.sent4: The old machine laboured to keep up with the demands of the factory.
meanings.sent5: The wind laboured against the sails of the ship, pushing it forward on its journey.
